hook.text: The Enlightenment said reason should rule. Emotion was suspicious.

buildup.text: Rational argument became the gold standard for Western discourse.

discovery.text: Evidence, logic, and structured argument dominated public speech.

twist.text: This bias toward rationalism excluded emotional and narrative ways.

climax.text: Western rhetoric's rational bias is a strength AND a limitation.

punchline.text: Reason matters. But it's not the only way.
